data.title: WSJ.com
data.text:
Ayad Allawi: Current prime minister. Shiite, former secretary-general of the Hussein-era opposition group Iraqi National Accord. He will remain in his job under the new Transitional National Assembly unless an opposing group gains control and removes him.

Adil Abdul-Mahdi: Minister of finance and a leading member of the Shiite group Supreme Council for the Shiite Revolution in Iraq (SCIRI). Son of a respected Shiite cleric, educated in France.

Ibrahim Jaafari: Holds one of two vice president spots. Shiite, main spokesman of the Dawa Party, which wants an Islamic government. Born in Karbala, received medical degree from Mosul University. He will remain in his job unless removed by the new assembly.

Hamid Majid Moussa: Shiite economist and leader of the Iraqi Communist Party. Former member of the Iraqi Governing Council.

John Negroponte: U.S. ambassador to Iraq since May 2004. He served as U.S. ambassador to the United Nations during the push for a unified invasion of Iraq in late 2001 and early 2002, and before that served as an ambassador to several Central American countries.

Rowsch Shaways: Holds one of two vice president spots. Kurdish. Parliament speaker in the Kurdish autonomous region in Irbil. A member of the Kurdistan Democratic Party, one of two rival parties running northern Iraq. Will keep his post unless removed.

Abdel-Aziz al-Hakim: Shiite cleric and leader of SCIRI. Former Governing Council member.

Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani: Highly influential Shiite cleric with close ties to Iran, where he was born. Observers say he is a politically astute pragmatist, and he would like to see a democratic government, which would be favorable to Shiites, the country's religious majority.

Carlos Valenzuela: Head of the U.N. team providing technical assistance to the Independent Electoral Commission, which is in charge of organizing the elections.

Ghazi Al-Yawer: Current president. Sunni, and a graduate of the Petroleum and Minerals University in Saudi Arabia and of George Washington University. Member of the Shammar tribe, one of the largest in the region. He will keep his job unless removed.
